intro: Draba bosniaca, commonly known as the Bosnian rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan region, particularly Bosnia and Herzegovina. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in early spring, followed by pods that contain several seeds. Draba bosniaca is characterized by its low-growing habit and is often found in mountainous and arid regions.
